New Records: The Cleveland Cavaliers became the first team in NBA history to win their first 10 games and score at least 110 points in each of them.
Key Match Events: Darius Garland scored 27 points and Evan Mobley had 23 as the Cavaliers routed the Golden State Warriors 136-117.
The Cavaliers built a 41-point halftime lead at 83-42, tying the eighth largest in the NBA’s shot clock era.
Ty Jerome scored a season-high 20 points against Golden State.
Pre-Game Insights: Coach Kenny Atkinson expressed concern about facing the Warriors, acknowledging their status as champions.
Post-Match Reflections: Kenny Atkinson expressed pride in the team's performance and their 10-0 record.
Jarrett Allen noted that the team has a long way to go and a lot of improvements to make.
Ty Jerome highlighted the selflessness of Donovan Mitchell and Darius Garland as key to their playing style.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavaliers equaled the team record for points in a half.
Cleveland has outshot their opponent in each game but has only won the rebounding battle four times.
The Cavaliers committed 19 turnovers that led to 30 points against the Warriors.
